comments.body:
Is there a new type of water called “salt water”? Does water just act strangely in this biome? What is a tank?  Are you talking about a tank as in “a tank of water” or as in “a tank that drives around and shoots things?  What kind of loot would there be?  What is this “amazing stuff”?  How come this “amazing stuff” is only accessible in this biome?

I really cannot vote on your idea until I know what you are talking about (if even then).
I barely understand this. I technically have the nearly same questions as Bilbo Baggins right now.

The Dead Sea is a phenomenon caused by water flowing into a basin and then evaporating.  The key is that it has no outlet and never entirely overflows, so the salt and other minerals that are in the water keep building up.

As such, this would make the most sense as a desert feature.  It should not be connected to any bodies of water.  The idea would be that rain runoff brings in new water and new minerals, since a river connecting to it would be complicated.

The extra buoyant water would need to be a new kind of water because it has its properties for a reason.  Some features of this new water could be that it "salts" any farmland near it (similar mechanic to water hydrating it), making it infertile.  It should be more buoyant than regular water, perhaps having almost a bubble-column-like effect.  Any mob that lives in water (fish, squid, dolphins, guardians) should take damage in salt water, for sure.  The Drowned aren't "alive", so they might be immune, ditto any undead mobs like skeletons.  I'm not sure how it should interact with the other liquids, though.  It could act like water when touching lava, but the tricky aspect is regular water.  Maybe a source block of salt water converts into regular water if regular water touches it, since there is no difference in Minecraft between seawater and freshwater.  It gets diluted enough by the water that it is no longer salt water.

I have no earthly idea what they mean by anything else.  I only know what a Dead Sea is. xP
So you basically want a biome with the old oceans minus squid?

No undead mobs can access 

because the sea is good for skin
Did you actually test those numbers?
I like the extra caves! Can I give a minus vote?
Yes, I actually tested those number by comparing them from the Java edition of minecraft to the bedrock edition with the plains biomes.
I prefer more caves. Even though you might have to patch them up occasionaly, I always found it difficult to find deep caves on console edition. Maybe a setting to choose the rarity of open caves.

I love my caves. My precious! You can't HAVE IT! It's mines I tell you, MINES! GIVE IT TO ME!!!
In all seriousness, I enjoy the caves. Removing them is not the way to go. I agree with the above comment that it should be a preference setting.
The caves in BE are great already. In JE they are impossible to find and don't go anywhere.

I disagree with this. The amount of caves on Bedrock is great and should stay. Java should instead copy Bedrock's cave system. In Bedrock, I almost always find a good, deep cave while in Java it's near impossible to find one.
What is the point of patching them up? It surely can’t be for red stone it doesn’t work in bedrock...
I meen mobs

I dont know if this is close enough to warrant a separate suggestion or not, but here i go.

A biome that allowed all friendly and hostile mobs to spawn, as well as allowed all one block flowers to be obtained from bonemealing grass blocks, and had a temperature about where the taiga biome is allowing both rain and snow, i think would be as big of a step towards a fully featured skyblock as the Wandering Trader. It could be just available for Superflat or Buffet presets like The Void. (The biggest reason i think this would be a more optimal solution compared to what can be done with a custom world map is that as other bioms gets added to the game, the more and more a skyblock world will be left behind as it is played for a vary long time in terms of available features)

That's a cool idea. I thought something different to as it was planned to do so. Something like a blue world with vegetation, animals and unique items.  Also with villages and villagers with whom they interact. In its architecture might be temples of blocks of quartz or a new white material, adorned with gold or other.

could you add to this idea: a new variant of spiders, 'Pale Spiders' these spiders would be the first truly neutral spider variant, as day or night they wouldn't attack the player unless the player messes with their cobwebs, either breaking them or getting stuck in them. This spider would also be a similar size to cave spiders.

That is a very good idea! Especially since you often walk backwards when faced with The Creaking.

Adding random holes or cave openings in the biome could have the same way. You fall into them when walking backwards.
antient şehre yeni bir boyut
new dimension to ancient city
I’ve been wanting that for my whole life. Please make it Minecraft please please please please please please please please

need more ecplanation but cool. I do want this. 

This is the oppinion of Dr. Thezbi Kazo
Mojang doesn’t add lists of ideas though. If you really want an idea, you must right about only one thing as far as I know. Lists are marked as spam.
Are we really about to put the Upside Down in minecraft lol, im down

I think it's what makes Minecraft so unike. That the music is rare and that it's just random.

Remember that when you play Minecraft, sometimes the music plays just at the perfect moment. And in my opinion, it's the "sometimes" that counts. If it would be all of the time "the perfect moment" then it wouldn't be so special anymore.

A more fitting way to do this in game might be to categorize the songs for hot, cold and mid temp biomes. This wouldn't give each biome a unique song just fitting music although i think most of the music in the game fits all the biomes.

This would be an awesome addition, similar to how the background ambience changes per biome in the nether. Something like this would add a really nice and cosy feel to the game while also helping add onto the mood for each biome.
This would be great when the deserts get updated, please see this mojang!
I feel that 1.20 will either be an end update, or some sort of hot update. Where they would update the mesa dessert and savannah.

The end should have a biome with tall glowing blue mushrooms and floating islands above y=130 or below y=40. The islands generate at least 1000 blocks away from the main island.

The floating islands would generate as a: lake island, island covered in shulkers or a phantom cage.

The lake island has a chest with moderate loot, 1-3 water falls and sometimes has moss blocks around the lakes edge.

The shulker island is small, has a chest that can have: feather falling potions, chain boots with protection 5 and unbreaking 3, emeralds, chorus fruit, diamonds, golden apples, etc.

The phantom cage is a phantom spawner surrounded by iron bars, the top of the cage is open, there is a chest under the spawner that can have: luck potions, diamond helmet, iron, gold, emeralds, diamonds, Amythest shards, lapis, etc.
The only way I would want this is if it was a setting
or maybe a new endgame boss!
sorry, that was unspecific, add a volcano biome in the wild update
More lore would be epic!
More lore would always be a positive change, and especially through the use of archaeology
maybe oranges too? make orange juice and fruit salad.
yum!

Minecraft put specifically that they will NOT implement anything from an existing mod.

I want the Aether as well, but it is not going to happen. Sorry
There is a mod for this. Funnily enough, the developer of the mod (Brandon Pearce, aka KingBDogz) was hired by Mojang last year. If they want to add the Aether, they will.
plase give aether and a new golem
We Really Need more Wood. We lack Of it and We Can't Build Colourful House

Came from the long post and this sounds really fun in context. Only thing I wanna say is that the portal frames should be a different shape than nether portals. Maybe it can be in the shape of the End Gateways currently, and keep that element of having to Ender Pearl(or crawl/swim) into them
I love your idea and I want more trees too. Especially for building purposes because there is always room for more wood colors. Great idea and I think squirrels should be in trees too.
Yes, an end update is much needed! Hopefully 1.18 is an end update!
i completely agree with this, the end is only good for the elytra, dragons breath, and shulker boxes
In this update can you change the texture of enderman
Y una armadura de enderium este nombre no copiaría al netherite
can you make a warden wild update and make a structure and biome later on June, thank you for talking about the latest update, I can't wait for June, hopefully there will be a warden there, thank you
Agree is should add enderium and Enderite and Enderite and enderium Upgrade
Can end soil not be that yellow color? Could it be purple like the end mites saliva changed it purple or something?
I don't think anything too saturated for the End Soil but a pale grey-purple might work in keeping with the desolate theme. Anything too bright might feel out of place

I think that, rather than use another shade of purple, it might be interesting to have this biome use the dark green palette used by ender pearls and the end portal frames.

It's worth remembering that the upcoming sculk growths use this color scheme as well (perhaps indicating some kind of connection), so maybe sculk growths should appear in this biome as well, providing another form of infestation in addition to the endermites.

On the other hand, having sculk growths show up in The End might take away from the uniqueness of the deep dark, so maybe they should stay out of The End.

I do think it would be good to expand the color palette of The End a bit, similar to what the Nether Update did for the Nether.

It would be really cool if the wood or leaves of the tree's of this biome changed season even when placed elswhere, so make it 'seasonal leaves' and 'seasonal planks' etc, where every 16 days the would would slightly change colour and the leaves would change to match what the season would be in the biome they were spawned. if this were added, it would also be good to 'fix' or freeze the seasonal variant of each block, such as if I really liked the autumn or spring variant I could make it stay as only that in builds.
This is a good idea but it kinda reminds me of minecraft dungeon and how would you get there
And a crafting table especially used only for building rockets and other stuff
Why stop at diamonds? Why not make every ore spawn more commonly in the Deep Dark, making the biome overall potentially very lucrative, but risky with the Wardens?

Agreed 100% - I've been exploring the deep caves for a while and I'm not seeing enough diamonds, or ores in general. It takes so long and is so risky exploring those caves in survival, not to mention the fact that you'd need to brew some night vision potions just to be able to see the walls and roofs of the caves. I feel like being rewarded for this kind of exploration with more visible diamonds and bigger veins. 

Quite often I'll find 2 block diamond "veins" in the deepslate and that's pretty trash.

Closer to core of the "Earth" = higher temperatures, more pressure = more diamonds. This will create a much bigger motivation to go down there.
This is a great idea! I was about to make a suggestion for this then i found this!
